Description:
Tested page : [+https://staging.agnesb.com/en-us/women_us/women_clothing_us/women_clothing_tshirts_tank_tops_us/dark-purple-%22agn%C3%A8s-b.%22-brando-t-shirt-2653S137_5009.html+|https://staging.agnesb.com/en-us/women_us/women_clothing_us/women_clothing_tshirts_tank_tops_us/dark-purple-%22agn%C3%A8s-b.%22-brando-t-shirt-2653S137_5009.html]

When we click on a size, a parameter is added to the URL: ?dwvar_2653S137__5009_color=5009&dwvar_2653S137__5009_size=3&quantity=1

The URL should not be modified when selecting the size, and no parameter should be added. Despite the canonical tag, Google will spend time crawling these URLs unnecessarily at the expense of other indexable URLs.

When we click on size 2 the URL should be the same : [+https://staging.agnesb.com/en-us/women_us/women_clothing_us/women_clothing_tshirts_tank_tops_us/dark-purple-%22agn%C3%A8s-b.%22-brando-t-shirt-2653S137_5009.html+|https://staging.agnesb.com/en-us/women_us/women_clothing_us/women_clothing_tshirts_tank_tops_us/dark-purple-%22agn%C3%A8s-b.%22-brando-t-shirt-2653S137_5009.html]

_FYI, the url naming still doesn't work for us, but I'll show you the destination url here._
Creator: Margaux Zermati

”

* The button "Load the next page" advances to the next page.
* Below this, numerical buttons such as 1, 2, 3... are direct links to specific pages.
* Always display a sequence of 5 pages in the pagination bar.
* The first and last page numbers should always be visible, regardless of the current page.
* Ellipses (...) are used to indicate that there are pages in between the displayed numbers that are not currently visible.

*Examples*:

* When on page 1:
** Load the next page
*** 1
*** 2
*** 3
*** 4
*** 5
*** ...
*** 15
* When on page 9:
** Load the next page
*** 1
*** ...
*** 7
*** 8
*** 9
*** 10
*** 11

Description:
Indexable URLs and canonical URLs must be the URLs of products in their parent categories.

Here, we have a product with "view all" in the URL and in the canonical: [https://staging.agnesb.com/en-us/women/clothing/view-all/Y375TCD7_6060.html|https://staging.agnesb.com/en-us/women/clothing/view-all/Y375TCD7_6060.html]

The canonical should be: [https://staging.agnesb.com/en-us/women/clothing/jumpsuits/Y375TCD7_6060.html|https://staging.agnesb.com/en-us/women/clothing/jumpsuits/Y375TCD7_6060.html]

If possible, we don't want breadcrumbs or URLs with "view-all" to exist.
If a product is clicked on from the view-all page, the url and breadcrumb trail must be the same as from the product's own category.
Creator: Clément ALBERTINI
Comment:
Hello,
The “view-all” is a category and if we want to see the full path to product we can not remove that. Same applies for url and canonical.

As for the categories we will need to show the "displayName" for each category but since we use the same site for example with US for Canada and USA we will need to have unique Category names for each locale. In case we don’t add a unique category name the platform tries to make uniqueness by adding “-1”, “-2”, etc. to the category name (example: “men-1”, “women-5”) which does not look good. However, if you provide us with unique category names for each category we will not have that inconvenience in the URL and canonical as well.

In case we want to have a specific URL for a certain category this can be added in the pageURL field in the category itself and it will override the default category URL with the "displayName".

[~accountid:61703a01860f78006bc5d56f] [~accountid:5efe11d06fddfb0bb40896c1] [~accountid:6093e700cc7830006a70da67] [~accountid:712020:c9c22b70-14a8-4f74-90df-38555fb891d3] ;Hello [~accountid:712020:20f7ecd6-f40a-4986-a404-5e1b815540dd] 
Thank you for your feedback.

I don't agree with your feedback.


# Concerning the view-all, I'm not talking about our categories made by hand in Akeneo, but the automatic “view all” configured +*on your side.*+
If you look at the view all, in FEMME, on ALL sites, the "view all" is not in the URL and is not in the breadcrumb trail.
*That's what we want :*

!image-20240327-130535.png|width=427,height=628,alt="image-20240327-130535.png"!

!image-20240327-130115.png|width=501,height=433,alt="image-20240327-130115.png"!



*Chiara needs to disable “view all” manually.*


# *About the category names.*
We can't put different names in all the locales and in the same language.
If we take the example of US and CANADA, the URLS are different because we have "en-us" and "en-ca" directories. So the URLs aren't the same, but we can have the same category name in the URL.

Salesforce must enable these two urls:
[https://staging.agnesb.com/en-ca/women|https://staging.agnesb.com/en-ca/women]
[https://staging.agnesb.com/en-us/women|https://staging.agnesb.com/en-us/women]

It also works for France, since there are no numbers in the URLs:
[https://staging.agnesb.com/fr-eu/femme_eu/|https://staging.agnesb.com/fr-eu/femme_eu/]
[https://staging.agnesb.com/en-eu/femme_eu/|https://staging.agnesb.com/en-eu/femme_eu/]

cc [~accountid:61703a01860f78006bc5d56f] [~accountid:5efe11d06fddfb0bb40896c1] [~accountid:6093e700cc7830006a70da67] [~accountid:712020:9938fca8-2f04-4c88-96a0-038cabdac283] [~accountid:712020:e4b1aecd-3571-4409-881f-7e59ca984d62] ;Hello [~accountid:621e3e27f1e55c0070ee0330] 

*About “view all”:*
I suppose this issue has been fixed with some of the other adjustments that we have made since I can not reproduce it.

*About Category names:*

In the second example you showed it has been used Category ID not the Name as we can differentiate based on the underscore.

In general if we would like to use the Category Name and not change the Categories in the menu, we will need unique pageUrl for each category for each locale (Example: women-us/ women-ca). The pageUrl is a category attribute and it can be easily changed at any time. The reason behind that issue with “men-1/ women-2” category names is a platform limitation, in other words the platform can not differentiate between: “women/clothing” for US and “women/clothing” for CA since there is no uniqueness in the category name based on the local.

Can you please provide us with the correct pageUrls for every category and for every locale for that category, so we will be able to make the URLs more user friendly.

Thank you in advance!

Nikolay

[~accountid:61703a01860f78006bc5d56f] [~accountid:5efe11d06fddfb0bb40896c1] [~accountid:6093e700cc7830006a70da67] [~accountid:712020:c9c22b70-14a8-4f74-90df-38555fb891d3] [~accountid:5e1edde7ee2e8f0ca83a381f] ;[~accountid:621e3e27f1e55c0070ee0330] could you ask the SEO agency to send us with the correct pageUrls for every category and for every locale for that category. I attached a file that can serve as a template. 

We mainly need the current URL and the desired one for each locale. 

Thanks[^8e780a67-d38c-4cd9-ae97-93bda22d89a7] ;Hello [~accountid:5efe11d06fddfb0bb40896c1] ,

We need to have a static url in SFCC to ask this subject.

Today, the URL aren’t not good in SFCC.

Thanks,

Clément;Hello [~accountid:621e3e27f1e55c0070ee0330] 

The issues related to the URLs are now fixed because of the following updates:
- Level 1 Categories are not clickable
- The indexing of the categories is now including the offline categories of the current catalog where we previously had a lot of conflicts (women-1, men-2, etc.)
- And category “view all” will be deleted so we will have only a button “view all” that points to the parent category

Please have a look at Staging environment on any of the sites and let us know if this is the expected behaviour.

Thank you!
Nikolay

[~accountid:61703a01860f78006bc5d56f] [~accountid:5efe11d06fddfb0bb40896c1] [~accountid:712020:c9c22b70-14a8-4f74-90df-38555fb891d3] [~accountid:6093e700cc7830006a70da67] ;Hello [~accountid:712020:20f7ecd6-f40a-4986-a404-5e1b815540dd] 

Thank you for your feedback.
And thanks for the corrections.

We still have a major problem, which I can only see on "new collection" products at the moment.

The new collection overrides the categories. If we click on this shirt (on the right), from its shirt category:

!image-20240403-094701.png|width=100%,alt="image-20240403-094701.png"!

the URL and breadcrumb trail, and the canonical change to "new collection" : 

!image-20240403-094734.png|width=100%,alt="image-20240403-094734.png"!

!image-20240403-095726.png|width=100%,alt="image-20240403-095726.png"!


*However, it's the url with "shirts" that should dominate.*
This problem is only linked to the new collection, because when I go through "view-all", or a marketing category like "made in france", it's the parent category that has the upper hand.

Thank you

cc [~accountid:712020:9938fca8-2f04-4c88-96a0-038cabdac283] [~accountid:712020:e4b1aecd-3571-4409-881f-7e59ca984d62] [~accountid:61703a01860f78006bc5d56f] ;[~accountid:621e3e27f1e55c0070ee0330] 

This happens because this is the primary Category of the product. We can have a product assigned to many categories but only one of them is primary. It is the same not only in the Canonical URL but in the URL itself which is a standard feature in the SFCC. In our example we will have to assign to this product “*shirts*” as primary category in the PIM.

!Screenshot 2024-04-03 at 5.06.49 PM.png|width=100%,alt="Screenshot 2024-04-03 at 5.06.49 PM.png"!

Can you please tell us if we can use the “*Product Category 1*” as source of truth for the primary category of the product that comes from Akeneo? If this can not be taken as the primary category, can you help us to understand which attribute that we receive from the PIM can be taken as such.

!Screenshot_108.png|width=75%,alt="Screenshot_108.png"!

[~accountid:61703a01860f78006bc5d56f] [~accountid:5efe11d06fddfb0bb40896c1] [~accountid:6093e700cc7830006a70da67] ;[~accountid:62c3f60ee16ddfe82bdf5832], peux-tu regarder ce retour et nous donner ton avis stp ?;Hello [~accountid:712020:20f7ecd6-f40a-4986-a404-5e1b815540dd] ,
[~accountid:62c3f60ee16ddfe82bdf5832] and I are having trouble understanding how this works.
Can you explain how the order of the categories is applied?
In your first screenshot, we can see that the order of the categories is different between the three storefronts. On the Akeneo side, the rules are created in the same way.
How does SFCC manage category order?
If I understand correctly, we have to send "top_shirt" first, but how?
We already do this via Akeneo.;[~accountid:621e3e27f1e55c0070ee0330] [~accountid:62c3f60ee16ddfe82bdf5832] 

We would like to understand if you have attribute on product level that shows which is the primary category so we can make this code adjustment in the Akeneo cartridge.
Thanks!

[~accountid:6093e700cc7830006a70da67] [~accountid:5e1edde7ee2e8f0ca83a381f] [~accountid:61703a01860f78006bc5d56f] [~accountid:5efe11d06fddfb0bb40896c1] ;Hello [~accountid:712020:20f7ecd6-f40a-4986-a404-5e1b815540dd] ,

Unfortunately, we use several attributes to manage categorization.
We cannot rely on the Primary Category.

In your screenshots, I see that the order of the categories on SFCC has an impact. Can we manage this with the order?

cc [~accountid:62c3f60ee16ddfe82bdf5832] ;[~accountid:621e3e27f1e55c0070ee0330][~accountid:62c3f60ee16ddfe82bdf5832]  

The OOTB behaviour of the Akeneo integration with SFCC is that it takes the first category for the product that comes from Akeneo and it assigns it as primary. We can not control the order of the categories that come from Akeneo but instead, we can use a specific attribute that comes from Akeneo and assign the category that comes with this attribute as primary. If you can provide us certain attribute that holds this value it will be really helpful to fix that general issue.

[~accountid:6093e700cc7830006a70da67] [~accountid:61703a01860f78006bc5d56f] [~accountid:5efe11d06fddfb0bb40896c1] ;[~accountid:62c3f60ee16ddfe82bdf5832] ,

Do you think it's possible?

Hi [~accountid:621e3e27f1e55c0070ee0330] ,

The issue is because sizes are coming from Akeneo with Category Assignment.

Only variation groups (colors) should be assigned to a categrory.

Do you know if this has been fixed because we had this kind of discussion a while ago? 
On EU Site looks ok because I cannot see sizes on the PLP so perhaps I need to re-run the job.

Overall, it’s a data issue, it’s not a code bug.

Best,

There is a topic about updating data. Connection and modifications with Akeneo should be instantaneous.  Only the delta must be published/modified in order to import.
Why is this no longer possible?

On the bags, you can see that the images go under the text.;Hello [~accountid:621e3e27f1e55c0070ee0330],

I have reviewed your comment and identified a design issue related to the menu. Currently, the menu is designed for two specific resolutions: mobile and large desktop screens. However, on smaller screens like yours, the menu appears larger and there is insufficient space to accommodate all the elements.

To address this issue, I propose two possible solutions:

# The first solution is a quicker fix, which involves adding a scroll feature when the menu is opened on small screens. This solution can be implemented in approximately 3 hours.
# The second solution is more comprehensive but requires more time to implement. It involves modifying the menu to resemble the mobile version for screens under 1300px. This solution would take around 3 days to complete. This is one possible solution.

Please let me know which option you prefer or if you have any further questions. Thank you!

Description:
Hello,

We have few problems on store locator tool : 

# We see all stores in the world, not just local store.
When i’m in US website, i see french and UK stores, and the map is unreadable :   

!image-20240319-201515.png|width=1235,height=656!

We want to have just US stores and US/ Canadian locales, EU stores and EU/ French locales, and UK stores on UK locale.



# When you arrived on store locator, we see in first time the corner shop (GL bordeau).

→ we need to see the boutique official in first time.


# There is a problem on US store (Madison). When you click on any filter, the shop disappared. *And i’m on US website.*

# Popin of filter, when you click on “show results” on the popin, the map and list are udapted but the popin doen’t close.
When you click on "show results", you should see the same behavior as when you click on the cross to close the pop-in.

# The store list and map are not well linked. 
When you click on a shop *in MAP, the list isn’t udapted with the selected store.*
When i click on a shop in MAP, i want to see the shop details in a list.

# Conversely, when I click on the store in the list, the map move, but we need to center the store and zoom in slightly. Is this possible?

# I see we can click on address shop, it’s open google map in a new window. Thanks for the proposition. But the click zone is too big, and i think all users will click on it unintentionally. I don't think we should have a link, or a "see on Google map" button. [~accountid:631b58598473817d7d0698eb] , what do you think?

You can find in attachement a video recording of store locator.

Thanks,

Clément
Creator: Clément ALBERTINI
Comment:
[~accountid:621e3e27f1e55c0070ee0330] When we can click on address shop, user will be redirected to the boutique pages of the stores, but now they are not configured. You need to do the store pages for each shop on the Business Manager.

FYI [~accountid:631b58598473817d7d0698eb] [~accountid:5efe11d06fddfb0bb40896c1] ;OK je prends le point.

Merci !
